modifications.title: Styles Access
modifications.description: JavaScript enables you to modify the CSS styles of elements in the DOM via the 'style' property of an element. For example, element.style.backgroundColor = 'blue'; changes the background color of the element to blue.

modifications.title: Classes Manipulation
modifications.description: Sometimes, rather than directly changing the style of an element, it's more practical to add, remove, or toggle CSS classes. The functions 'classList.add()', 'classList.remove()', and 'classList.toggle()' are useful tools for this purpose.
